attributes.action: retain the Intra-Company Transfer Route under Tier 2 of the Points Based System of immigration. The economic consequences of abolishing the ICT will be extremely grave for the UK economy, will weaken the UK's position as a major global business location and will inevitably lead to retaliatory action from our major trading partners.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Government’s  Migration Advisory Committee (MAC) is considering  restricting Tier 2 to shortage occupations only.  This would be detrimental to the UK economy since:

1. International assignments are  fundamental to talent management within any global organisation. 

 
2. International assignees are not long term immigrants to the UK and are not a burden on the state.

3. Any reduction in the number of intra-company transfers would have devastating consequences for many related industries including: rental and serviced accommodation, removals and shipping, relocation management, international schools and the like.


4. Any reduction in in-bound assignees would inevitably lead to retaliatory action by other countries thus reducing opportunities for British workers


This petition is presented by the Forum for Expatriate Management and Totallyexpat News.
